usefulItems: baking paper, jug, plate, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl
title: Cauliflower 'fried' rice

ingredients.content: 2 ½ cm piece fresh ginger, peeled
180 g brown onion, cut into quarters
12 sprigs fresh coriander, stalks and leaves, cut into thirds
100 g red capsicum, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g fresh shiitake mushrooms, cut into halves
400 g cauliflower, cut into florets (approx. 3 cm)
50 g fresh bean sprouts, plus extra for garnishing
2 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into slices (optional)

preparations.content: Line Varoma tray with a piece of wet, well-wrung baking paper. Make sure paper goes all the way to the edges to prevent the egg mixture from spilling. Crack eggs into a jug and beat lightly with a fork. Pour into lined Varoma tray.
Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>10-12 min/Varoma/speed 2<b> or until eggs are cooked to your liking.
Remove cooked egg, cut into strips and transfer onto a plate. Discard water and dry mixing bowl.
Place ginger, garlic, onion, coriander and capsicum into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add 1 tablespoon of the coconut oil, then mushrooms and cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Transfer into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place remaining 1 tablespoon oil into mixing bowl and heat <b>2 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add cauliflower and Brussels sprouts into mixing bowl and chop <b>2-3 sec/speed 5<b> or until evenly chopped.

Add cooked egg and cook <b>6-9 min/100°C//speed 1<b> or until cooked to your liking. Transfer into thermal serving bowl or other large bowl. Add tamari, Shaoxing wine and bean sprouts and gently stir to combine with aid of spatula.
Season with salt, then garnish with cashews, spring onions/shallots (optional) and extra bean sprouts before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Shaoxing wine (also known as Chinese cooking wine) can be found in the international aisle of most major supermarkets and at Asian food stores.
